definitions.definition: being an essential part of something

examples.text: Music is **an integral part of** the school's curriculum.
Practical experience is integral to the course.

definitions.definition: included as part of something, rather than supplied separately

examples.text: The unit comes complete with integral pump and heater.

definitions.definition: having all the parts that are necessary for something to be complete

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from late Latin integralis, from integer ‘whole’, from in- (expressing negation) + the root of tangere ‘to touch’. Compare with integrate and integrity.
